name: aspirate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ]
  biology, medical
  specialized to breathe in, or to breathe a substance into your lungs by accident: They lose control over their swallowing reflex and aspirate saliva. Giving the patient food too soon after the procedure can cause the patient to aspirate. Synonym
inhale
[ T ]
  medical
  specialized to remove a liquid or gas from a space in the body using suction (= a sucking action): If a cyst becomes painful, it can be aspirated or drained of its fluid. Fluid aspirated from the knee is sent to the laboratory for analysis.
[ T ]
  phonetics
  specialized to breathe out air when pronouncing a plosive consonant sound: Native speakers of Arabic often do not aspirate their Ps when they speak English.

aspirate noun
(SOUND)
[ C ]
  phonetics
  specialized a consonant sound that is pronounced with air being breathed out: proto-Germanic voiced aspirates
[ C ]
  phonetics
  specialized the sound represented in English by the letter "h", in words such as "house": "'E is 'orrible!" she said, forgetting her aspirates in her emotion.

aspirate noun
(SUBSTANCE)
[ C or U ]
  medical
  specialized a substance, usually a liquid, that has been removed from a space in the body using suction: If the aspirate tests negative for atypical cells, does that mean you do not have breast cancer? Gastric and oesophageal aspirates were collected. the volume of gastric aspirate
